com.github.tilastokeskus.minotaurus.scenario

Interface Scenario

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable, Plugin
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractScenario, TestScenario

    public interface Scenario
extends Plugin
    A scenario is a situation, or a world, that a simulation aims to model. A scenario answers questions such as what is each runner's role, what do they aim for, what is allowed and how they are rewarded for their actions.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Scenario clone()
      Returns a shallow copy of this class instance.

      Returns the maximum amount of runners allowed for using this scenario, or 0 for no maximum.

      Returns the minimum amount of runners required for using this scenario.

      Returns a predicate that tests if a position is allowed to be visited by a runner.

      Returns the goals of the specified runner.

      Attempts to move a runner in some direction.

      Places the given runners in a maze.
      void reset()
      Initializes the scenario to the state it was in when it was first created.

        setTitle

    • Method Detail

      • setMaze

        void setMaze(Maze maze)
        Sets the maze this scenario should adjust to. A scenario needs the maze to place the specified runners, as well as do other scenario-specific actions, like placing goals.
        Parameters:
        maze - Maze to adjust to.

      • getScore

        int getScore(Runner runner)
        Returns a runner's current score.
        Parameters:
        runner - A Runner.
        Returns:
        The Runner's current score.

      • setScore

        int setScore(Runner runner,
             int score)
        Sets a runner's current score.
        Parameters:
        runner - A Runner.
        score - Score to set for the runner.
        Returns:
        The runner's previous score.

      • getMinRunners

        int getMinRunners()
        Returns the minimum amount of runners required for using this scenario.
        Returns:
        Minimum amount of runners.

      • getMaxRunners

        int getMaxRunners()
        Returns the maximum amount of runners allowed for using this scenario, or 0 for no maximum.
        Returns:
        Maximum amount of runners.

      • placeRunners

        boolean placeRunners(Collection<Runner> runners)
        Places the given runners in a maze.
        Parameters:
        runners -
        Returns:
        True if the runners were placed successfully, false otherwise.

      • isCollisionAllowed

        boolean isCollisionAllowed(MazeEntity ent1,
                           MazeEntity ent2)
        Returns whether or not the given two entities are allowed to be on the same location, to collide.
        Parameters:
        ent1 - A maze entity.
        ent2 - A maze entity.
        Returns:
        True if collision is allowed between the entities, false otherwise.

      • getPositionPredicate

        Predicate<Position> getPositionPredicate(Runner runner)
        Returns a predicate that tests if a position is allowed to be visited by a runner.
        Parameters:
        runner - A Runner.
        Returns:
        A predicate.

      • handleRunnerMove

        boolean handleRunnerMove(Runner runner,
                         Direction direction)
        Attempts to move a runner in some direction. If the movement is not allowed, the runner is not moved.
        Parameters:
        runner - Runner to move.
        direction - Direction in which the runner should be moved to.
        Returns:
        True if the movement was allowed, false otherwise.

      • getRunnerGoals

        List<MazeEntity> getRunnerGoals(Runner runner)
        Returns the goals of the specified runner.
        Parameters:
        runner - A Runner.
        Returns:
        A list of goals the runner should aim for.

      • getModifiableSettings

        Map<String,Setting> getModifiableSettings()
        Returns a map of settings that are modifiable by the user. The key is the name, and value the setting.
        Returns:
        A String - Setting map, or null if there are no modifiable settings

      • reset

        void reset()
        Initializes the scenario to the state it was in when it was first created.

      • clone

        Scenario clone()
        Returns a shallow copy of this class instance.
        Returns:
        A MazeGenerator.
